title: 820-3476-A
message:
Hi guys.

I have this A1502 with no power. I have all power lines present,  U1900  I replaced them just in case, PM_SLP_S4_L  is present, no short anywhere. I had the camera chip U3900 heating up near contacts 14 and 29 and I removed it not heating up anymore. Now when I plug it in, as before green light comes on with no power and only U2800 warms up to nearly 30 degrees and nothing else. What I noticed is that when I have the SSD plugged in(tried 2, and one is known good) warms up the main controller on it up to 45-50 degrees and continues slowly up. Do any ideas come up, cause going in circles here  o_O :ROFLMAO:

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Do you have correct CPU core voltage?
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

title: 820-3476-A
message:
PLT_RESET_L  it's 0v. on the power trigger, it's 3v and reacts when pressed... 
U1950 voltages:
pin1:  0v
pin2 : 3.3v
pin3 : 0v  of course :D
pin4: GND
pin5/7: 0v
pin6: 0v
pin8: 3.3v

L7310/20 voltage  not present

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Pin 7 & 3 MUST reacts at same time with PLT_RESET_L.

If SSD gets hot, 3V3_S0 must be there.
That implies PM_SLP_S4/3_L presence.
Check voltage on SSD connector.

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Yes PP3V3_S0 it's 3.3v. 
Voltages on SSD connector:
Pin1/5 PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT 3.3v
Pin 7 - 3.3v
pin 47 - 3.3v

title: 820-3476-A
message: btw i just noticed L7130 pin 1 it's 55.8v and pin2 normal at 12.6v. Not sure if Pin 1 should be like that

title: 820-3476-A
message:
I told millon of times to people to check ALWAYS voltage on DC side (output) of a coil from buck converters!

"That implies PM_SLP_S4/3_L presence."
Did you check that?

title: 820-3476-A
message: Yes all are checked and i receive 3 and 5v for power , no shorts.  PM_SLP_S4/3_L  are pesent. Anything else?

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Then you should have voltage on all coils, including CPU.

"PLT_RESET_L  it's 0v. on the power trigger, it's 3v and reacts when pressed"
I'm not sure what this means.

title: 820-3476-A
message:
"PLT_RESET_L it's 0v. on the power trigger, it's 3v and reacts when pressed" 
PLT_RESET_L it's 0v.
on the power trigger button, it's 3v and reacts when pressed to power on. 

I have PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCAPLL_OPI, but no PPVCC_S0_CPU

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Trigger and press power button is not the same for you?
Try to be clear.
You have all voltages before pressing power button, but PLT_RESET_L is 0V?
PLT_RESET_L (only) pulse to 3V pressing power button and drops when release the button?
Or it stays at 3V until press again power button?

title: 820-3476-A
message: ok to avoid confusion. When i press the power button  PLT_RESET_L  stays 0v no change

title: 820-3476-A
message: Also, when plugged in the power supply shows 0.084a on 16.5v and stays like that no change even i power button is pressed

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Looks like missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
Which voltages are present and stable, when you connect charger?

Remove Q8150 and test the board again.

title: 820-3476-A
message: Without Q8150 i get on Bios, 3 and 5v, previously mentioned CPU voltage same, PPBUS_G3H is 12.6v,  ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0v of course, but diode mode good ,Q7320/10 are 12.6v on PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING. on Q7700 pin 3 and 4 i get 12.6v. There are all stable, anything else to measure?

title: 820-3476-A
message: Even with Q8150 all voltages are stable. I rechecked the board again for shorts and corrosion, but nothing found

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Do you get L7430/630 and L7870 voltage?
If yes, start to remove the resistors from ALL_SYS_PWRGD (one by one).
Keep in place R8167.

title: 820-3476-A
message:
The following are measurements without Q8150
L7430 - 0v
L7630 - pin1 5.4v and pin 2 1.05v
L7870 - 1.5v

This morning I just plugged in the adapter and I got a fan spin(no Q8150 on the board) and it goes high speed, of course, no picture or backlight.

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Fix the RAM voltage now.
Check U7400 voltage, pins 12, 16, 17.
Be sure all resistors around are good.

"I have all power lines present"
Next time post them; avoid wasting time, because you forgot ONE!

title: 820-3476-A
message:
U7400:
pin12 - 3.3v
pin16 - 3.3v
pin17- 3.2v
R7416 is 39k instead of 200k
R7415 is 17k but not a big difference it should be 19.6k
All other resistors around U7400 are fine, R8111 20k, R7418 51k, R7417 200k, R7401 is 10, R7425 is 0.

On C7401 PP1V35_S3 i have 0.080 diode mode and no voltage, and also on C7425 pin 2 diode mode 0.080 and no voltage

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Be aware, resistor value measured onboard is not accurate; especially for high values (K/Mohm).

Change U7400...

title: 820-3476-A
message: I changed U7400 but I lost PP5V_S4, When the original U7400 is on the board i have PP5V_S4 and all measurements as mentioned before, with 2 other U7400 i lost PP5V_S4...Green and orange light still comes on in any case...

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Did you test in SMC bypass?

Remove R8168 and try again.

title: 820-3476-A
message: Removed R8168 and smc bypass, still same no change

title: 820-3476-A
message: Test removing Q8150 too.

title: 820-3476-A
message: Same thing o_O

title: 820-3476-A
message: Check all components around U7400...

title: 820-3476-A
message: I checked all resistors taken out from the board and the only one around U7400 that was lower resistance was R7416, instead of 100k it's 60k...

title: 820-3476-A
message:
What is actual diode mode to ground at L7430?

Check again U7400 voltages; pins 12, 17, 16, 6, 1, 5.
Just in case, change C7425.

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Just got back to this one...

L7430 diode it's 0.085 and also on C7425. But in the meantime before I saw your msg I reballed the SMC and the laptop started, but no picture just the fan spinning fast. I would reprogram the Bios to see what's gonna happen.

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Which voltages get you now, in big coils?
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

title: 820-3476-A
message: PLT_RESET_L  it's 3.3v now. Also i had one resistor moved near the Bios Chip. But, also i forgot from before i had taken out Q8150 and just saw it's not on the board... I'll solder it back and try again.

title: 820-3476-A
message: I've soldered all back on the board, now when i plug it in fan starts spinning fast and increasing and no image... fast slows down after 1 min and speeds up again afterwards

title: 820-3476-A
message:
Did you solder that resistor near the BIOS chip.
Check all SPI Bus Termination resistors and their traces.
Clean J6100, if needed.

Just in case, try known good BIOS.
